Detailed Description

Calibration of the Calice ECAL modules.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

CALICE::CaliceEcalCalibration::CaliceEcalCalibration ( const std::string &  module_type_col_name,
const std::string &  calibration_constants_col_name 
) throw (std::runtime_error)

Create the calibration object for the Calice Ecal.

The constructor will register handlers for conditions data changes: changes of the module types and the calibration constants.

Member Function Documentation

void CALICE::CaliceEcalCalibration::calibrationConstantChanged ( lcio::LCCollection *  col  ) 

Notify the calibration object when ever the calibration constants change.

This function must be called at least once before getCalibratedValue() is used.

Bool_t CALICE::CaliceEcalCalibration::checkForCalibrationConstantsOfModule ( UInt_t  module_id,
UInt_t  module_type,
UInt_t  n_cells 
) const [inline]

Verify that calibration constants exist for a certain module.

Parameters:
module_id id Or serial number of a module which uniquely identifies a detector module of a certain type.
module_type the type of the detector module
n_cells the number of cells on this module. Return true if calibration constants exist for the given module and the number of cells matches the number of calibration constants.

UInt_t  module_type,
UInt_t  cell_index,
Float_t  adc_value 
) const [inline]

Determine from a pedestal subtracted ADC value a calibrated value.

Parameters:
module_id id Or serial number of a module which uniquely identifies a detector module of a certain type.
module_type the type of the detector module
cell_index the cell_index in read order: first the ADC values of the first sample from all chips, then the next sample ...
adc_value the ADC value which should be calibrated.
Returns:
the calibrated value.

Definition at line 42 of file CaliceEcalCalibration.hh.

References _calibrationConstantsPerType.

Int_t CALICE::CaliceEcalCalibration::getMiniumADCForMipThreshold ( Float_t  mip_energy_fraction  )  const [inline]

Get the minimum adc value mips will have for the given energy fraction on all pads.

Parameters:
mip_energy_fraction the energy in mips
Returns:
minimum adc value which is below the given energy on all pads. This method can be used to get the lowest adc value a mip of the given energy fraction will have on all pads. This value is useful to select candidates before actually performing th calibration. This function is intended to be called at the beginning of each event.

Definition at line 114 of file CaliceEcalCalibration.hh.

Bool_t CALICE::CaliceEcalCalibration::isValid ( UInt_t  module_id,
UInt_t  module_type,
UInt_t  cell_index 
) const [inline]

Return true if a the calibration constants for the given cell are in the allowed range.

Parameters:
module_id id Or serial number of a module which uniquely identifies a detector module of a certain type.
module_type the type of the detector module
cell_index the cell_index in read order: first the ADC values of the first sample from all chips, then the next sample ...
Returns:
true for cells with valid calibration constants, false for cells which should be declared dead.

This method is used to find, after module connection changes, cells which should be declared dead.

Field Documentation

CalibrationConstantPerTypeList_t CALICE::CaliceEcalCalibration::_calibrationConstantsPerType [private]

Calibration constatns per Module.

The first array component is the module type, the second the serial number of the module.
